issues.title: Missing Mandatory Reporting to Local Health Officer
issues.description: California Code of Regulations requires immediate reporting of communicable diseases to the local health officer. While the AR mentions reporting "presence or suspected presence of any communicable disease," the BP lacks any reference to this mandatory reporting requirement, and neither document specifies the required timeframe or method.

legal_citations.text: The health officer of the health department having jurisdiction shall be notified immediately by telephone of cases and suspected cases of the diseases listed in subsection (a) and shall be notified within one working day by mail, facsimile, or other electronic means.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall immediately report to the local health officer by telephone any case or suspected case of a communicable disease, followed by written notification within one working day.

issues.title: Missing Specific Exclusion Criteria and Procedures
issues.description: Health and Safety Code requires specific procedures for excluding students with communicable diseases. While the BP mentions exclusion "in accordance with law," neither document provides the required specific criteria, timeframes, or readmission procedures mandated by state law.

legal_citations.text: Any person in charge of a school shall exclude from the school any pupil who shows symptoms of any communicable disease reportable to the local health officer or any other infection or infestation deemed by the local health officer to be communicable.

issues.required_language: Students shall be excluded from school if they show symptoms of any communicable disease reportable to the local health officer or any other infection deemed communicable by the health officer. Excluded students may return to school only upon recovery or with written permission from the local health officer.

issues.title: Missing Immunization Requirements Reference
issues.description: California Education Code requires schools to maintain policies addressing immunization requirements for attendance. Neither the BP nor AR references the connection between infectious disease control and mandatory immunization requirements.

legal_citations.text: The governing authority of a school or the person in charge thereof shall not unconditionally admit or advance any pupil to the 7th grade level of any private or public elementary or secondary school for the first time in this state unless the pupil has been immunized for his or her age as required by this section.

issues.required_language: Students must meet all immunization requirements as specified in Education Code 49403 and related regulations as a condition of school attendance, except as otherwise provided by law for medical exemptions.

issues.title: Missing Emergency Response Coordination
issues.description: While the AR includes comprehensive planning elements, it lacks specific reference to coordination with county emergency management during infectious disease emergencies as recommended by state guidance.

legal_citations.text: Each political subdivision within this state shall be within the jurisdiction of and served by the California Disaster and Civil Defense Agency and by a disaster council.

issues.required_language: The district shall coordinate with local emergency management agencies and follow established emergency protocols during infectious disease outbreaks that may require emergency response measures.
